page.title: 03Bredwardine; Transport.
page.content: The A438 Hereford to Brecon road passes through the north-eastern corner of the area and the B4352 Madley to Hay-on-Wye road runs across the south-western section, closely following the contour of the hills. Connecting these is a network of narrow lanes with high banks topped by hedges and trees. Transport services in the area are very sparse. There are school buses daily from Bredwardine, a daily bus to and from Hereford, and, on market days, a weekly bus to Hereford and to Hay-on-Wye. At other times there is no means of going shopping, or of attending doctors' or dentists' surgeries (which are outside the area), other than by private car. Thus it is essential for every family living in the area to have a car, or at least easy access to one.
